intro: Daviesia acicularis, commonly known as the needle-flowered daviesia, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and its clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often seen in heathlands and coastal areas. Daviesia acicularis is a member of the legume family and has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
